content.description: The rate, in calories per minute, at which a person using an exercise machine burns calories is modeled by the function \(f\). In the figure above, \(f\left(t\right)=-\frac{1}{4}t^3+\frac{3}{2}t^2+1\) for \(0\le t\le4\) and \(f\) is piecewise linear for \(4\le t\le24\).
content.question: Find the total number of calories burned over the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn> 6 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 18 </mn> </mrow> </math> minutes.

frqParts.text: Find the total number of calories burned over the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn> 6 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> t </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 18 </mn> </mrow> </math> minutes.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Use appropriate units of measure.
